none: Northwestern University Marching Band on WGN-TV
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
Northwestern University Marching Band first appearance at 01:09:30 (General Note)
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music

Northwestern University Marching Band appears on the WGN-TV morning news. The marching band is featured throughout the three hour morning show. Director of Bands Rodney Dorsey is interviewed and previews the upcoming Homecoming Game salute to the 1949 alumni. The band performs cheers, "Hey Baby" and "Go U Northwestern." The program concludes with the band marching into WGN's studio.

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
